\text{after diffrentiating the equation we get}\\ \frac{d(2x + 3y)}{dx}=\frac{d(\sin x)}{dx}\\ \Rightarrow 2 . \frac{d(x)}{dx}+3 . \frac{d(y)}{dx}=\frac{d(\sin x)}{dx} . \frac{d(x)}{dx}\\ \Rightarrow 2 +3 . \frac{dy}{dx} = \cos x \\
\text{After rearranging,}\\ \frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{\cos x - 2}{3}
